intro: Randia canthioides, commonly known as the redroot sandvine, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Randia canthioides is typically found in moist, sandy soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
